results.title: Mao: long march to power
results.creator_credit: Don Thompson, Pat Ferns, Sam Summerlin, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Leaders of the twentieth century: portraits of power”.
First in a two part film on Mao Tse-tung. His beginnings as a peasant farmer through to his rise to power in the 1949 revolution are highlighted in this film. Attention is also given to Sun Yat Sen’s nationalists: Chiang Kai-shek and Mao’s Communist Party of 1921. Narrated by Henry Fonda. Suitable for upper secondary levels.

results.title: Muchmore's marvellous machine
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Mathematics for elementary school students: whole numbers”.
Introduces children to the mathematical whole number concept of the decimal system. Suitable for middle primary level.

results.title: Learning about sound. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introduction to physical science”.
This film presents the basics of sound, starting with its source - vibrations emanating soundwaves. An oscilloscope visualises the frequency and amplitude of sound waves. An experiment with railway tracks compares the speed of sound through air and through metal.

results.title: Learning about magnetism. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introduction to physical science”.
This film explores the mysteries and practical applications of magnetism. The subject of magnetic fields is dramatised with scenes of a 75-T electromagnet with a magnetic field so huge that its expanse can be viewed only from a helicopter.

results.title: Learning about electric current. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Thomas Smith and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introduction to physical science”.
This film is an introduction to the principles of electricity. Laboratory experiments and animated drawings illustrate the chemical, magnetic and heat effects of electric current. Scenes include such things as copperplating, and the flow of electrons within the filament of an incandescent bulb.

results.title: Turning, facing and boring
results.creator_credit: K. Baron Hartley and Brent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Lathework series”.
A flanged bush of phosphor bronze is seen being machined from a rough casting, a job which introduced the operations mentioned in the title of the film. The different tools used are mounted on a four-way tool post, and each in turn is seen in use. Chamfering is also demonstrated.

results.title: An Introduction to the lathe
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Lathework series”.
Various operations are shown briefly, then a simple type of lathe is examined systematically, headstock, cradle, tailstock, methods of holding the work by chucks, by face plate and between centres. Methods of feed, hand and automatic.
